items._title: What Is Team Memory? (And Why Engineering Teams Need It)
items.description: Define team memory as a category, explain why engineering teams need it, and how Lightfast helps them find answers, understand context, and trace decisions across their organization.

body.plainText: Team memory is a new way to think about how engineering organizations remember what they decided, shipped, and learned. In this post we define what a team memory system is, why it matters now, and how Lightfast helps teams and agents find answers with sources instead of digging through wikis and chats.

items._title: Team Memory vs Knowledge Bases vs RAG: How to Choose the Right Approach
items.description: A practical guide comparing traditional knowledge bases, bespoke RAG stacks, and team memory platforms—so you can pick the right approach for your engineering org.

body.plainText: Should you keep investing in a wiki, build your own RAG stack, or adopt a team memory platform? We compare these approaches across setup effort, maintenance, coverage, explainability, and agent compatibility so you can make an informed decision for your organization.

items._title: Search by Meaning, Not Keywords: How Teams Actually Find Answers Faster
items.description: Why semantic search matters for internal knowledge, and how Lightfast’s hybrid retrieval pipeline helps teams find the right answer—even when no one used the exact words.

body.plainText: Keyword search breaks down when people don’t remember exact filenames, ticket IDs, or phrases. We walk through how Lightfast combines dense vectors, lexical signals, graph relationships, recency, and cross‑encoder reranking so that queries like "who knows about authentication" or "why did we migrate databases" actually return useful answers.

items._title: Giving AI Agents Shared Memory: A Practical Guide for Builders
items.description: How to give your AI agents access to reliable team memory using Lightfast’s four API routes and MCP tools, without stuffing entire codebases into context.

body.plainText: Agents are powerful but blind without access to the history of your systems. In this guide we show how to wire agents into Lightfast using the /v1/search, /v1/contents, /v1/similar, and /v1/answer routes and MCP tools so they can fetch just‑in‑time context with citations instead of hauling megabytes of code into every prompt.

items._title: Measuring Answer Quality: Citations, Explainability, and Trust in Team Memory Systems
items.description: A deep dive into how to measure answer quality in internal AI systems, with a focus on citations, faithfulness, and explainability in Lightfast.

body.plainText: For internal AI assistants, "looks plausible" isn’t enough. We outline the metrics that matter for team memory—recall, citation coverage, rationale faithfulness, and user trust—and show how Lightfast uses them to keep answers grounded in real documents, discussions, and decisions.

items._title: Incident Reviews and Postmortems with Team Memory: Never Lose Context Again
items.description: How SRE and platform teams can use team memory to run faster incident reviews, find all the relevant context, and avoid repeating the same mistakes.

body.plainText: After an incident, the hardest part is reconstructing what really happened across PRs, tickets, deploys, and chats. We show how team memory helps incident commanders and reviewers quickly pull together the relevant timeline, see who did what when, and capture decisions with citations so the lessons actually stick.

items._title: Onboarding Engineers 5× Faster with Team Memory
items.description: A playbook for using team memory to help new engineers ramp up quickly by answering their questions with sources and ownership context.

body.plainText: New hires spend weeks asking basic questions like "how does auth work?" or "who owns billing?". We walk through an onboarding journey where Lightfast acts as team memory, showing how new engineers can self‑serve answers with citations, see ownership and dependencies, and ramp up in a fraction of the time.
